title: Polynomial Functions and Operations

vocab.definition: Expression with variables and coefficients having non-negative integer exponents
The highest power of the variable in a polynomial
The coefficient of the term with the highest degree
How function behaves as x approaches positive or negative infinity
Number of times a factor appears in a polynomial

teachingNotes: Use graphing technology to explore polynomial behavior. Connect to real-world modeling situations. Emphasize relationship between degree and graph shape.

sample.question: What is the leading coefficient of -3x + 2x?
What describes behavior as x approaches infinity?
What is an expression with non-negative integer exponents?
What is the number of times a factor repeats?
What is the highest exponent in a polynomial?
What determines if ends go up or down?
What causes a graph to bounce at a zero?

truefalse.question: A polynomial of degree n can have at most n real zeros.
The degree is always the sum of all exponents.
End behavior is determined by leading term.
All polynomials have at least one real zero.
Even multiplicity causes the graph to bounce.
Odd degree polynomials have opposite end behaviors.
Leading coefficient determines left end behavior only.
A zero with multiplicity 3 crosses the x-axis.
All polynomials are defined for all real numbers.

multiplechoice.question: What is end behavior of f(x) = -2x + 5x - 1?
How many zeros can a degree 5 polynomial have?

fillintheblank.question: A polynomial of degree n has at most _____ real zeros.
Even _____ causes the graph to bounce.
Polynomials are _____ for all real numbers.
Odd degree polynomials have _____ end behaviors.
A zero with multiplicity 2 causes a _____.

shortanswer.question: Explain how the leading coefficient affects end behavior.
expectedAny: positive leads up for even degree and down-to-up for odd while negative is opposite
determines if function rises or falls at extremes
sign controls whether ends go up or down combined with degree parity

shortanswer.question: What does multiplicity tell you about a zero?
expectedAny: how many times the factor appears and whether graph crosses or bounces
number of repeated roots affects graph behavior at that point

shortanswer.question: Why can a degree n polynomial have at most n zeros?
expectedAny: fundamental theorem of algebra limits zeros to degree
each zero corresponds to a linear factor maximum n factors
polynomial factorization gives at most n linear terms

shortanswer.question: Describe end behavior of f(x) = 2x - 5x + 1.
expectedAny: both ends go up because even degree with positive leading coefficient
fourth degree positive so both tails rise

shortanswer.question: How do you find the degree of a product of polynomials?
expectedAny: add the degrees of the factors
multiply highest powers so degrees sum
degree of product equals sum of individual degrees

shortanswer.question: Explain the difference between a bounce and a cross.
expectedAny: bounce has even multiplicity and touches axis while cross has odd and goes through
even multiplicity tangent odd multiplicity intersects
bounce at double root cross at single root

shortanswer.question: Why are all polynomials continuous?
expectedAny: defined by smooth operations addition and multiplication no breaks
algebraic structure ensures no jumps or holes

shortanswer.question: How does degree affect the shape of a polynomial graph?
expectedAny: higher degree allows more turns and complexity
degree n can have up to n-1 turning points
determines maximum number of direction changes

shortanswer.question: What is the relationship between zeros and factors?
expectedAny: each zero r corresponds to factor (x - r)

shortanswer.question: Explain what a quartic polynomial is.

wordProblems.question: Company profit is P(x) = -0.5x + 12x - 50x + 200 where x is thousands. What is degree and long-term behavior?
expectedAny: degree 3 negative lead coefficient so profit eventually decreases
cubic with negative coefficient means losses at high production
third degree negative leading term ends down

wordProblems.question: If f(x) has zeros at x = -2, 1, and 3 with multiplicities 2, 1, and 1, what is minimum degree?
A polynomial g(x) = ax + bx + c. If both ends go down, what is true about a?
Volume of a box is V(x) = x(10 - 2x)(8 - 2x). What is the degree?
Polynomial p(x) crosses x-axis at x = 2 and bounces at x = -1. Write possible form.
expectedAny: linear factor at 2 squared factor at -1

wordProblems.question: If h(x) = 2x - 6x + 4x, factor completely.
expectedAny: factored form shows zeros at 0, 1, and 2

wordProblems.question: Population model P(t) = -t + 8t + 100. What happens long-term?
expectedAny: negative x dominates so both ends go down

wordProblems.question: If polynomial has end behavior both up and zero at x = 3 with multiplicity 2, write simplest form.
Revenue R(x) = -2x + 20x - 50x. How many turning points possible?
